alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 17 at 1:01PM CST until February 17 at 1:15PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL PHILLIPS...NORTHEASTERN COAHOMA...SOUTHWESTERN TUNICA AND CENTRAL QUITMAN COUNTIES... At 101 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Kings, or 7 miles northwest of Clarksdale, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clarksdale, Jonestown, Friars Point, Belen, Darling, Kings, Sherard, Dundee, Coahoma, Lyon, Lula, Falcon, Gerlach Mill, Rudyard, Moon, Westover, Beverly, Clover Hill, Matagorda and Rich. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
